text: Hi <@U06AKE32H53> I think we had a similar goal here but on my end we want to get the email address however, having a hard time to get this. Using your code, are you able to get get the email address? Please let me know, hoping to get your help. Thanks!

there is a settings inside the website settings that allows you to remove jquery

settings, content, pages, templates

I suggest watching the youtube videos taht the developer advocate group has put out an dwalked through these items I suggest looking at the ui extensions example library, and using the help pages first.

Being a HubSpot beginner and new to ui extensions, you are going to have SO many questions. I really suggest learning more on your own before asking someone to drag you through this. That is a lot of time to devote to one person
That would be a better channel to ask questions in

We’ve tried to use *contactAssociated* event but it seems it’s not working.

What isn’t working with this?

Do you have error messages? is the trigger not happening? have you just console logged to see that this event happens in real time? what is teh issue?

Hi <@U25PYL3Q8>, we thought that *contactAssociated* event is to confirm if the submitted email from the form we created will trigger this. However, this event didn't trigger even if the email that we submitted is an existing user.

Our main goal here is when a user successfully send the email, we will mark this an event in GA4. ATM the conversationStarted only works.

Do you have any idea on how to get this done or do we need to modify our code?
this event happens when a user is understood to have a connection to the CRM
the best way to test this is to do this in an incognito window and go through the flow, console logging out each of events

I’d do something like
```window.HubSpotConversations.on( 'contactAssociated', function( payload ) { console.log('contact Assocatted:', payload) })```
but do that for all of your events, this will help you learn the lifecyle of these events and when they trigger
In incognito window, I’d use chrome if possible, and make sure you have no ad blocking stuff on
